title: Question:
author: LoveUJack
created_time: August 30, 2022, 09:15:33 PMLast edit: October 27, 2022, 03:59:41 PM by LoveUJack
content: So, as many of us have already noticed, Preev.com is frequently going down. In an era ruled by CoinMarketCap/CoinGecko/Nomics, Preev.com was still a thing for many of us. We liked it for its simple interface. But, now, as the boat is sinking, we were looking for an alternative. Interestingly, many have sprung up quickly to fill the void. So, I collected them from various threads discussing those on BitcoinTalk and putting it forward to all of you for a vote.Which one is your most favorite alternative to Preev.com?- Preev.com- myri.io- pnnv.com- 100bit.co.in- oh.gold- coinconvert.net- preev.net- btc2fiat.meAfter you cast your vote, please mention the WHY in a comment below.

comments.author: GreatArkansas
comments.body: Most of the mentioned platforms above are the same and similar.I'll go with the easiest to memorize domain which is myri.io and pnnv.com, and I also notice that all of them can be used as a calculator with the real current price of Bitcoin, which most of the time is what the most people need when they want a quick calculation.

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Sorry if I may be disappointing some people here and there, but right now my favorite is one... that's not yet on your list either: https://preecs.coolstorage.org/  (maybe you can still add it? actually there are many others that could be added to the list, including https://bitcoindata.science/bitcoin-units-converter.html)Also, as said, some of those from your list do have (at least for now) the exact same software behind, making for some the choice stand in the preference in website name, where preev.net has a good chance for winning.Plus, since preev.net will most probably change or improve the script, even my favors may be shifting towards it sooner or later.

comments.author: salad daging
comments.body: I checked all of them are almost similar but I prefer a white and simple interface maybe my favorite is myri.io to use the converter from mBtc to USD for easy and I often use this.Sometimes I also use Coinmarketcap to do it while looking at the prices of other coins there.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: How many Preev.com's treads do we need? I don't know why this site has gained so much popularity, but all this number of posts within a month is enough.The options are multiple, and all of them are the same, and since they often do not show ads, why not use more than one?

comments.author: agentF
comments.body: As the owner of PNNV.com.I can assure you that you will get supported with your requests and also I'm about to add new features.

comments.author: Little Mouse
comments.body: There are more too. I have seen one coinconvert.net on the service ANN section if I'm correct. However, among all these new sites, I got impressed by pnnv.com though the domain name is a bit weird. They could have a better domain name instead.Quote from: hugeblack on August 31, 2022, 06:38:39 PMHow many Preev.com's treads do we need?Come on. Most people don't know about the alternatives available. However, there can be another reason. To bring the one which need to be shilled as form of genuine interest. I have seen this many times here. A group of people post/reply on purposes.

If I include that, I'll need to include many others like https://nomics.com/markets/btc-bitcoin/usd-united-states-dollar etc. In any case, if more people mentions https://preecs.coolstorage.org, I'll include it in the poll.In another post on BitcoinTalk, I came across two more domains, running the same script. These, I believe, can become alternative to Preev.com. So, I am including those as well...i. https://coinconvert.netii. https://oh.gold

comments.author: LTU_btc
comments.body: It's difficult to say which one is the best. Some is just copycats of original Preev, others use Coingecko API and others - script from GitHub. In terms of functionality and design there is not much difference. So, I got with domain which is easiest to remember for me. And it's Preev.net. Though, I must admit that Oh.Gold is good one, even if it's not related with crypto. And most important, it's original.

comments.author: pooya87
comments.body: No favorites yet since we have to see how reliable they are.Another problem with some of these sites is that they are usually relying on one source for price which is not a direct exchange either. For example btc2fiat and preev.net are 100bit look the same and all seem to be using coingeko for their source. myri.io is short and looks the same but uses only bitstamp. Any good alternative, in my opinion, should have a short domain name that is easy to remember and fetches the price from multiple sources all being actual bitcoin exchanges. Not third party APIs like coingeko, coinmarketcap, etc. and maybe no altcoin exchange like Binance.Some sources could be: Bitstamp, Coinbase, Kraken, Gemeni
